ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine saw Shadow Wing and ignored her he knew now wasn t the time for talk. The only thing that could come from it would be an argument. He looked at his

Received: from [10.1.10.97] by fh.egroups.com with NNFMP; 06 Jul 2000 00:11:16 -0000
Date: Thu, 06 Jul 2000 00:11:07 -0000
To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
Message-ID: <8k0iqr+7v49@...>
In-Reply-To: <20000705225829.83715.qmail@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2631
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: cyberwolf4@...

Lunarpine saw Shadow Wing and ignored her he knew now wasn't the time 
for talk. The only thing that could come from it would be an 
argument. He looked at his arm, she got him pretty good, but his 
internal repairs would handle the damage. Right now all he wanted to 
do was rest. He entered the base and went to his quarters to rest. 

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She flew back to the base after she calmed down.   She knew that 
she was no 
> fighter.  She felt dissapointed in herself.  She thought she could 
make him 
> think that she could make it.  But she failed herself as well as 
him.  She 
> knew he was a fighter, a better hunter.  He would survive.  She 
transformed 
> into her bot mode.  She lifted her head, swallowed her spark, and 
walked in. 
>   She saw Lunarpine out of the corner of her eye.  She didn't turn 
to face 
> him, she just kept walking.  She knew her emotions were her 
weakness.  But 
> she couldn't help it.  Her spark was as big as the rest of her. 
Normally she 
> wouldn't mind, but now, she hated that fact.  She just walked to 
her room 
> and sat on her bed.  She leaned forward, rested her head in her 
hands and 
> started to cry again.  She hated and liked him at the same time.  
And now 
> she couldn't even look at him.  She wanted to rip out her spark. 
She just 
> sat there and let her spark burn.
> 
> 
> ---original message----
> From:   <cyberwolf4@p...>
> Date: Wed Jul 5, 2000 10:44pm
> Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
> 
> 
> Lunarpine could see her pain, Shadow Wing wasn't programmed as a
> warrior. He saw that now, he fealt for her but knew that a wolf and
> an owl weren't meant to work together, were they? He turned back to
> the crow and gobbled it up. In his world scavenging food was just as
> important as hunting it. Shadow Wing was a good hunter as an owl but
> she didn't seam to realize that she was more. she has the ability to
> change into something that gives her an edge yo the hunt. If she
> could learn that, she might survive. In the cold he'd want her at 
his
> side, but he still wasn't sure how she'd fight in this climate. Her
> emotions were her weakness. One moment she wanted the hunt, the 
kill,
> the next moment she wanted to run away and hide.
> "I'm sorry." he said more to himself than to her. "I'm sorry I had 
to
> do that to help you survive."
> Lunarpine wiped his mouth and headed back to base, alone again.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
